definition: theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
ardent/intense/fierce/stern/upright/to give one's life for a noble cause/exploits/achievements

sentences.english: But in future chips, cores’ bandwidth requirements could fluctuate wildly.
sentences.chinese: 但在未来芯片中，核心的带宽需求会剧烈波动。

sentences.english: Clothing saturated with oxygen is readily ignitable and will burn vigorously.
sentences.chinese: 吸饱了氧的衣物很容易点燃，而且燃烧剧烈。

sentences.english: Violent crust movements always happen near the continental shelf.
sentences.chinese: 陆坡区域的地壳经常出现剧烈的活动。

sentences.english: In the ages of information, the environment of market changes fastly.
sentences.chinese: 在信息化时代，市场环境变化剧烈。

sentences.english: After the Boomed Accident, the house of Babula changed violent.
sentences.chinese: 那次爆炸后，巴布拉的家就起了剧烈的变化。

sentences.english: Today the business environment is more petitive and fast-changing than ever.
sentences.chinese: 现今的商业环境，竞争愈发剧烈，变革弹指之间。

sentences.english: A fascinating picture of these robust nanomachines is emerging.
sentences.chinese: 一副关于这些剧烈反应的纳米机器的图画正在出现。

sentences.english: The severe chest pain experienced by the Vice-president proved to be a heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 副总理剧烈的胸口痛被证实为心脏病。

sentences.english: He was struck by a stabbing pain in his midriff.
sentences.chinese: 他突然感到腹部一阵剧烈疼痛。

sentences.english: It is the commitment of central bank to smooth the volatility of the foreign exchange market in the short interval.
sentences.chinese: 烫平短期汇市剧烈波动是中央银行的职责。

sentences.english: The career of Arians will witness some radical changes.
sentences.chinese: 羊儿们的事业将面临一些剧烈变化。

sentences.english: It quickly combusts and soon it disappears into the air.
sentences.chinese: 钾在空气里会剧烈燃烧，很快就会消失。

sentences.english: When wilt thou sort an hour great strifes to end?
sentences.chinese: 你选定什么时辰终止剧烈的纷争？

sentences.english: Economic globalization has also led to more enterprises to face fierce competition.
sentences.chinese: 而经济的齐球化也招致企业要里临更剧烈的合做。

sentences.english: It's not as demanding as shoveling snow.

definition: to undulate/to fluctuate/wave motion/rise and fall
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
to pull back/to shrink/to contract/(physiology) systole
